implementationmode.label: Implementation mode
implementationmode.helperText: Choose the type of work the agent should perform.

options.label: Feature
options.description: Ship new user-facing behavior end-to-end.
options.instruction: New functionality must be delivered with production-ready TypeScript/React code that matches existing architecture and patterns.

options.label: Bugfix
options.description: Eliminate regressions with the minimal safe change.
options.instruction: The regression root cause must be identified, the minimal safe fix must be applied, and preventative tests must accompany the change.

options.label: Refactor
options.description: Improve structure without altering behavior or scope.
options.instruction: Current behavior must be preserved while restructuring the code for clarity and maintainability; new capabilities must not be introduced.

options.label: Exploration
options.description: Investigate options and recommend a concrete plan.
options.instruction: The problem space must be investigated, viable implementation approaches must be compared, and a path must be recommended with trade-off analysis.

scope.label: Scope
scope.helperText: Describe how broad the change should be.

options.label: Small
options.description: Touch a focused area (one or two modules).
options.instruction: Work must be kept tightly scoped (one or two modules) and collateral changes must be minimized.

options.label: Medium
options.description: Coordinate changes across several modules.
options.instruction: Updates must be coordinated across several modules and any required sequencing or coupling must be highlighted.

options.label: Large
options.description: Plan staged delivery for broad, multi-area work.
options.instruction: Staged delivery must be planned for broad changes, including migration steps, safeguards, and rollback strategy.

options.label: Required
options.description: Ship full automated coverage with the change.
options.instruction: Automated tests must be implemented or updated to validate the change, covering critical and edge scenarios.

options.label: Recommended
options.description: Outline priority tests and add smoke coverage.
options.instruction: The most valuable automated tests must be outlined and at least smoke coverage must be added when possible.

options.label: Not needed
options.description: Explain why tests are skipped but keep code testable.
options.instruction: An explanation must be provided for why automated tests are not needed while keeping the implementation test-ready for future coverage.

runtimeaccess.label: Runtime access
runtimeaccess.helperText: Clarify whether commands can be executed.

options.label: Can run code
options.description: Provide concrete commands to execute builds/tests.
options.instruction: Command execution may be assumed to be permitted; exact commands to run builds, tests, or smoke checks must be provided.

options.label: No execution
options.description: Rely on static reasoning and flag follow-up checks.
options.instruction: Code must not be run; static reasoning must be relied upon and areas requiring manual verification later must be called out.

documentation.label: Documentation
documentation.helperText: Set expectations for docs and notes.

options.label: Docs required
options.description: Update docs, READMEs, and inline explanations.
options.instruction: Documentation, inline comments, and any user-facing notes impacted by the change must be updated.

options.label: Notes only
options.description: Capture key decisions without formal docs.
options.instruction: Key decisions must be captured inline or in the PR summary without full documentation rewrites.

options.label: No docs
options.description: Skip documentation unless clarifications are required.
options.instruction: Documentation updates must be skipped unless critical clarifications are required.

surfaceareas.label: Surface areas
surfaceareas.helperText: Select all areas this work touches.

options.label: Frontend UI
options.description: React components, Zustand stores, theming.
options.instruction: Existing React component patterns, Zustand stores, theming tokens, and accessibility expectations must be honored.

options.label: Backend
options.description: Express server endpoints, APIs, persistence.
options.instruction: Express server contracts and API schemas must be guarded, and backend changes must align with client expectations.

options.label: Shared
options.description: Shared utilities, TypeScript models, cross-layer logic.
options.instruction: Shared utilities and TypeScript types must be updated carefully, and any cascading impacts across layers must be noted.

options.label: Infra
options.description: Tooling, CI/CD, build, and deployment paths.
options.instruction: Required adjustments to build scripts, tooling, CI pipelines, or deployment configuration must be called out.

options.label: Testing
options.description: Automated test suites and harness updates.
options.instruction: Automated tests must be strengthened across unit and integration layers, ensuring meaningful coverage of the change.
